sqldiff.help:
USE: The diffs are ordered by data model version number. The script can be run in a top down fashion and is expected to not fail or overwrite old data
EXPECT: - "use business-database-name;" was called prior to calling this script

diff.author: FGH
diff.sql:
INSERT INTO openmrs.global_property VALUES ('disa.api.password', 'disa', 'api password', '2686097c-871b-11e9-898c-0242ac120002', NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL), ('disa.api.url', 'http://dev.fgh.org.mz:8085/services/viralloads', 'APHL data source to collect viral load data', 'e07cdb3f-871a-11e9-898c-0242ac120002', NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL), ('disa.api.username', 'disa', 'api username', '23294c5c-871b-11e9-898c-0242ac120002', NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL), ('disa.mandatory', 'false', 'true/false whether or not the disa module MUST start when openmrs starts. This is used to make sure that mission critical modules are always running if openmrs is running.', 'e4705f4d-437b-454a-99cf-9bd6aa126ce7', NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL), ('disa.started', 'true', 'DO NOT MODIFY. true/false whether or not the disa module has been started. This is used to make sure modules that were running prior to a restart are started again', 'd54c25dd-cbeb-4317-b306-4b1a3e68a8ae', NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
CREATE TABLE `fsr_log` ( `id` int(11) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT, `patient_id` int(11) DEFAULT NULL, `encounter_id` int(11) DEFAULT NULL, `patient_identifier` varchar(50) DEFAULT NULL, `request_id` varchar(50) DEFAULT NULL, `creator` int(11) DEFAULT NULL, `date_created` datetime DEFAULT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`) ) ENGINE=InnoDB AUTO_INCREMENT=2 DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8;
